name: xwiki
description: XWiki is a powerful self-hosted enterprise wiki and knowledge management platform. It supports structured data, scripting, extensions, and fine-grained permissions, and can be deployed on-premises or via hosted services.
features: Structured content: Create pages with custom data structures using classes and properties for database-like organization.
Advanced permissions: Control access at page, space, and element levels with user groups and fine-grained rules.
Extension ecosystem: Install applications and macros from the extension repository to add functionality without coding.
Scripting support: Embed Velocity, Groovy, and JavaScript code in pages for dynamic content and automation.
Version control: Track all page changes with full revision history, diff viewing, and rollback capabilities.
Multi-wiki support: Host multiple independent wikis on a single installation with shared or separate user bases.
WYSIWYG editor: Edit pages with a visual editor or switch to wiki markup for advanced formatting control.
Search and indexing: Find content quickly with full-text search across pages, attachments, and metadata.
Application builder: Create custom applications within the wiki using forms, databases, and templates without external tools.
LDAP integration: Authenticate users against Active Directory or other LDAP servers for centralized identity management.
REST API: Access and modify wiki content programmatically for integration with external systems and workflows.
Notification system: Subscribe to page changes and receive email or in-app notifications for collaborative editing.
